Package drawit.shapegroups2

Class Extent

java.lang.Object
drawit.shapegroups2.Extent
public class Extent
extends Object
Each instance of this class represents a nonempty rectangular area in a 2D coordinate system, whose edges are parallel to the coordinate axes. This class must deal with illegal arguments defensively.
Immutable
Any two calls of any zero-argument getter of this class on the same target object return equal values. (A getter is a method whose name starts with "get" or "is" followed by a capital letter.)
Invariants:
getLeft() < getRight()
getTop() < getBottom()
getRight() < 0 || getRight() - Integer.MAX_VALUE <= getLeft()
0 <= getLeft() || getRight() <= getLeft() + Integer.MAX_VALUE
getBottom() < 0 || getBottom() - Integer.MAX_VALUE <= getTop()
0 <= getTop() || getBottom() <= getTop() + Integer.MAX_VALUE
getWidth() == getRight() - getLeft()
getHeight() == getBottom() - getTop()

    • getTopLeft

      public IntPoint getTopLeft()
      Returns the top-left corner of this extent.
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.equals(new IntPoint(getLeft(), getTop()))

    • getBottomRight

      public IntPoint getBottomRight()
      Returns the bottom-right corner of this extent.
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.equals(new IntPoint(getRight(), getBottom()))

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(IntPoint point)
      Returns whether this extent, considered as a closed set of points (i.e. including its edges and its vertices), contains the given point.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if point is null 
      point == null
      Postconditions:
      result == (
    getLeft() <= point.getX() && point.getX() <= getRight() &&
    getTop() <= point.getY() && point.getY() <= getBottom()
)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Extent other)
      Returns whether this extent equals the given extent.
      Postconditions:
      result == (
    other != null &&
    getTopLeft().equals(other.getTopLeft()) &&
    getBottomRight().equals(other.getBottomRight())
)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object other)
      Returns whether this extent equals the given object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Postconditions:
      result == (other instanceof Extent && this.equals((Extent)other))

    • ofLeftTopWidthHeight

      public static Extent ofLeftTopWidthHeight​(int left, int top, int width, int height)
      Returns an object representing the extent defined by the given left, top, width, and height.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given width is not positive 
      width <= 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given height is not positive 
      height <= 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if the sum of left and width is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      Integer.MAX_VALUE - width < left
      IllegalArgumentException - if the sum of top and height is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      Integer.MAX_VALUE - height < top
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == left
      result.getTop() == top
      result.getWidth() == width
      result.getHeight() == height

    • ofLeftTopRightBottom

      public static Extent ofLeftTopRightBottom​(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
      Returns an object representing the extent defined by the given left, top, right, and bottom.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given right is not greater than the given left 
      right <= left
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given bottom is not greater than the given top 
      bottom <= top
      IllegalArgumentException - if the width of the given extent is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      0 <= right && left < right - Integer.MAX_VALUE ||
left < 0 && left + Integer.MAX_VALUE < right
      IllegalArgumentException - if the height of the given extent is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      0 <= bottom && top < bottom - Integer.MAX_VALUE ||
top < 0 && top + Integer.MAX_VALUE < bottom
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == left
      result.getTop() == top
      result.getRight() == right
      result.getBottom() == bottom

    • withLeft

      public Extent withLeft​(int newLeft)
      Returns an object that has the given left coordinate and the same right, top, and bottom coordinate as this object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given left coordinate is not less than this extent's right coordinate 
      getRight() <= newLeft
      IllegalArgumentException - if the width of the resulting extent is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      0 <= getRight() && newLeft < getRight() - Integer.MAX_VALUE ||
newLeft < 0 && newLeft + Integer.MAX_VALUE < getRight()
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == newLeft
      result.getTop() == getTop()
      result.getRight() == getRight()
      result.getBottom() == getBottom()

    • withTop

      public Extent withTop​(int newTop)
      Returns an object that has the given top coordinate and the same left, right, and bottom coordinate as this object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given left coordinate is not less than this extent's right coordinate 
      getBottom() <= newTop
      IllegalArgumentException - if the width of the resulting extent is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      0 <= getBottom() && newTop < getBottom() - Integer.MAX_VALUE ||
newTop < 0 && newTop + Integer.MAX_VALUE < getBottom()
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == getLeft()
      result.getTop() == newTop
      result.getRight() == getRight()
      result.getBottom() == getBottom()

      newRight <= getLeft()
      IllegalArgumentException - if the width of the resulting extent is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE

getLeft() < 0 && getLeft() + Integer.MAX_VALUE < newRight

      result.getTop() == getTop()

      result.getBottom() == getBottom()

    • withWidth

      public Extent withWidth​(int newWidth)
      Returns an object that has the given width and the same left, top, and bottom coordinate as this object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given width is not positive 
      newWidth <= 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new right coordinate would be greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      Integer.MAX_VALUE - newWidth < getLeft()
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == getLeft()
      result.getTop() == getTop()
      result.getWidth() == newWidth
      result.getHeight() == getHeight()

    • withHeight

      public Extent withHeight​(int newHeight)
      Returns an object that has the given height and the same left, top, and right coordinate as this object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given height is not positive 
      newHeight <= 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new bottom coordinate would be greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE 
      Integer.MAX_VALUE - newHeight < getTop()
      Postconditions:
      result != null
      result.getLeft() == getLeft()
      result.getTop() == getTop()
      result.getWidth() == getWidth()
      result.getHeight() == newHeight
